metadata.title: CVE-2019-17069 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
PuTTY before 0.73 might allow remote SSH-1 servers to cause a denial of service by accessing freed memory locations via an SSH1_MSG_DISCONNECT message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-17069` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pterm - 0.73-1
putty - 0.73-1
putty-tools - 0.73-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: putty package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.73-1').
